subject: Leadership
title: Handling Conflicts of Interest
description: A quick, practical guide to Handling Conflicts of Interest.

hook.text: Your supplier offers your kid an internship. Coincidence? Probably not. Conflicts of interest hide in plain sight.

buildup.text: A conflict of interest exists when personal gain could influence professional judgment, even if it never actually does.

discovery.text: Moore's research: people are poor judges of their own conflicts. We believe we're objective even when we clearly aren't.

twist.text: Disclosure alone doesn't fix conflicts. Studies show disclosing a conflict can make advisors feel licensed to be biased.

climax.text: Disclose conflicts. Recuse when necessary. Build policies that prevent conflicts rather than just managing them after.

punchline.text: If you have to ask whether it's a conflict, it probably is.

quiz.question: Why is disclosure alone insufficient for conflicts of interest?
options: It can make people feel licensed to be more biased
